entities.name: SPONSORS
entities.description: Sponsors are companies or organizations that provide financial support to sports teams, athletes, or events in exchange for advertising and brand exposure

entities.name: Culture
entities.description: Culture encompasses the customs, traditions, beliefs, and behaviors that characterize a society or group. It includes shared experiences, values, and practices.

attributes.Influenced by Sports: Sports play a vital role in shaping culture through shared experiences, traditions, and economic impact.

entities.name: Major sporting events
entities.description: Significant gatherings where major sports competitions are held.

entities.name: gender norms
entities.description: Gender norms are the shared expectations and rules that guide behavior of people based on their gender. These norms can influence various aspects of life, including social interactions, roles, and opportunities.

entities.name: pride
entities.description: Pride is an intense feeling of accomplishment and satisfaction derived from supporting and being part of a community that celebrates athletic achievements.

entities.name: brands
entities.description: Brands are identifiers that distinguish products or services from those of competitors. In the context of sports, brands can be associated with teams and athletes, attracting sponsors and endorsements.

attributes.Purpose: Distinguishing products or services from competitors

entities.name: Language Barriers and Political Divisions
entities.description: Barriers that can divide people based on language or politics.

entities.name: LOCAL ECONOMIES
entities.description: Local economies are the economic systems of specific regions, often stimulated by the hosting of major sporting events

entities.name: resilience
entities.description: The ability to recover quickly from difficulties and adapt to adversity.

entities.name: economy
entities.description: The economy is the system of production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.

entities.name: LOCAL GAMES
entities.description: Local games are sports or competitions that are organized and played within a specific community, often fostering local pride and community spirit

entities.name: FANS
entities.description: Fans are individuals who support and follow their favorite sports teams or athletes, often participating in the cultural aspects of sports

entities.name: DISCRIMINATION
entities.description: Discrimination is the unjust or prejudicial treatment of different categories of people, often addressed by athletes who use their platforms to speak out against such practices

entities.name: male-dominated sports
entities.description: Male-dominated sports are those in which men have historically been the primary participants and where women"s participation has been limited or marginalized.

attributes.Historical Context: Traditionally, these sports were dominated by male athletes.
attributes.Gender Participation: Primarily participated in by men, with women"s participation being limited or marginalized.

entities.name: SPORTS
entities.description: Sports are a broad category of activities that involve physical exertion and skill, often organized into competitive events and played for entertainment, health, and social reasons

entities.name: teammates
entities.description: Teammates are other athletes who play on the same team, working together towards a common goal.

entities.name: SPORTS-RELATED SERVICES
entities.description: Sports-related services are activities or offerings that are associated with sports, such as training, coaching, and event management

entities.name: SPORTS-RELATED PRODUCTS
entities.description: Sports-related products are items or services that are associated with sports, such as equipment, apparel, and media coverage

entities.name: values
entities.description: Values are principles or standards of behavior; one"s judgment of what is important in life.

entities.name: sense of belonging and pride
entities.description: A sense of belonging and pride is a feeling of connection and identity that fans experience when they come together to support their favorite athletes or teams.

entities.name: DISCIPLINE
entities.description: Discipline is the practice of training oneself to follow rules, controls, or a specific regimen, often developed through participation in sports

entities.name: teamwork
entities.description: The ability to work collaboratively with others towards a common goal.

entities.name: FAILURE
entities.description: Failure is the lack of success, often experienced in sports and used as a learning opportunity to improve and grow

entities.name: Sports Industry
entities.description: The sports industry includes all activities related to sports, such as professional leagues, equipment manufacturing, and media coverage.

entities.name: ANCIENT CIVILIZATIONS
entities.description: Historical societies that developed complex cultures and technologies before the era of modern civilizations.

entities.name: ATHLETES
entities.description: Athletes are individuals who participate in sports, often at a professional level, and serve as role models and advocates for social issues

entities.name: SUCCESS
entities.description: Success is the accomplishment of an aim or purpose, often celebrated in sports through victories and achievements

entities.name: LIFE SKILLS
entities.description: Life skills are abilities that are essential for navigating and succeeding in various aspects of life, often developed through participation in sports

entities.name: MODERN SOCIETIES
entities.description: Modern societies are contemporary human communities characterized by advanced technology, complex social structures, and a wide range of cultural practices, including the widespread participation in sports

entities.name: stereotypes
entities.description: Preconceived notions about groups based on characteristics like gender, race, or occupation.

entities.name: INTERNATIONAL TOURNAMENTS
entities.description: International tournaments are large-scale sporting events that bring together participants from different countries, promoting global unity and competition

entities.name: global economy
entities.description: The global economy encompasses all economic activities and interactions across the world, including trade, finance, and production.

entities.name: Political Divisions
entities.description: Differences in political beliefs and ideologies that can divide people.

entities.name: revenue
entities.description: Revenue is the income generated from business activities, such as sales or services.

entities.name: competition
entities.description: A contest where participants vie for victory based on skill, strength, or strategy.

entities.name: People from Around the Globe
entities.description: People from different countries and cultures.

entities.name: People
entities.description: People are individuals who form communities or groups based on shared interests, beliefs, or backgrounds.

entities.name: women
entities.description: Women are individuals who identify as female. They play significant roles in various aspects of society, including sports.

attributes.Role in Society: Significant contributors to social change and economic development

entities.name: social justice
entities.description: Social justice refers to the fair and equitable treatment of all members of society, particularly in terms of rights, opportunities, and access to resources.

entities.name: belonging
entities.description: A sense of connection and unity among individuals sharing common interests.

entities.name: ENDORSEMENTS
entities.description: Endorsements are agreements where athletes or teams promote products or services, often generating significant revenue

entities.name: ECONOMIC IMPACT
entities.description: The economic impact of sports refers to the financial benefits generated by major sporting events, including job creation, tourism, and local economic stimulation

entities.name: HOST CITIES
entities.description: Host cities are locations that are chosen to host major sporting events, benefiting from the economic and cultural impact of these events

entities.name: FAVORITE ATHLETES
entities.description: Favorite athletes are individuals who are particularly admired and supported by fans, often for their skills, achievements, and personal qualities

entities.name: FAIR PLAY
entities.description: Fair play is the principle of conducting oneself in a just and honorable manner, especially in competitive sports, promoting integrity and respect

entities.name: TOURISM
entities.description: Tourism is the activity of traveling for pleasure, often boosted by the hosting of major sporting events

entities.name: positive change
entities.description: Positive change refers to the process of improvement or development towards a more beneficial state.

entities.name: equality
entities.description: Equality refers to the state of being equal, especially in status, rights, and opportunities.

entities.name: Language Barriers
entities.description: Differences in language that can hinder communication between people.

entities.name: OLYMPICS
entities.description: The Olympics are a major international multi-sport event that brings together millions of people from around the globe, transcending language barriers and political divisions

entities.name: TRADITIONS
entities.description: Traditions are customs or beliefs that are passed down through generations, often including sports-related practices and events

entities.name: perseverance
entities.description: The ability to persist and endure difficulties without giving up.

entities.name: inclusivity
entities.description: Inclusivity refers to the practice of including and valuing all individuals, regardless of their background, abilities, or identities.

entities.name: Bridges
entities.description: Bridges are connections or pathways that link different groups or communities.

entities.name: communities
entities.description: Communities are groups of people who share common interests or characteristics. In the context of sports, communities can be brought together by their shared passion for a team.

entities.name: WORLD CUP
entities.description: The World Cup is a major international soccer tournament that brings together millions of people from around the globe, transcending language barriers and political divisions
